school year I was told that the
news section of the News-Letter
should restrict itself to reporting

paying constituency.
I wondered how our reading
constituency felt about that.
While the News-Letter is staffed
and funded by and for undergraduates, its purpose is to
report on the many aspects
of university life. This includes
such diverse issues as rent
control, admissions procedures,
cocaine busts, employee concerns, child care centers, tenure,
and student politics. I felt
that whatever affected or concerned Hopkins students ought
to be reported. The distinction

between grad and undergrad

good deal of interaction between
the two groups exist and what

other.

certainly, our readers would find
new perspectives on Homewood
life an interesting change. I was
also under the impression that

outweigh any "disadvantages."

A disgruntled N-L staffer once

assault. Secondly, and more important,

same thing happen again.
